page.title: 14HIGH CROSS CHURCH TOWER.
page.content: St. Johns' church did not have a tower until 1906. Today,the tower is the main landmark of the village. From the outside,it looks just like a really old Norman tower,so common in Herts. The outside is clad with blocks of weathered limestone,but on entering the inside of the tower,the true age is clearly seen,for it is of modern brick construction. We were able to climb to the top of the tower. The floor above the vestry is reached by a narrow spiral staircase. On this floor is a large clock,made in Leeds and built into the tower in 1906. It shows the time on the N. and W. sides. A very steep and tall ladder took us to the bell floor. There is only 1 small bell here. Another ladder took us to the top of the tower,where the view was excellent. Climbing down the ladders,was much worse than going up!.
